title: Package Development Notes
text: Contains daily notes details things developed. Primarily following https://r-pkgs.org/.

title: Package Development Notes
text: Grouping PDC functions together common .R file documentation (https://github.com/centralstatz/readmit/issues/9) Updated documentation across files better align best practices (https://r-pkgs.org/man.html#roxygen2-basics) Changed hsr_extract_payment_summary function return wide format. Added helper functions (non-exported) consolidate repeated code convenience functions. Used use_import_from("rlang", ".data") resolve global binding issue. hsr_extract_coefficients function, used .data pronoun (dplyr::filter(!.na(.data$Value))) 1 note regarding NEWS.md
code: ❯ checking package subdirectories ... NOTE   Problems with news in ‘NEWS.md’:   No news entries found.  0 errors ✔ | 0 warnings ✔ | 1 note ✖

title: Package Development Notes
text: Created functions extract Table 1 HSR components: hsr_extract_payment_summary individual functions. defined .R file grouped Rd file. Probably need clean. Stil debating default behavior pivoted data frame .

title: Package Development Notes
text: Added dependencies well: httr, readr, tibble Added inital tests functions Still notes global bindings
code: hsr_extract_coefficients: no visible binding for global variable     ‘Value’   pdc_datasets: no visible binding for global variable ‘issued’   pdc_datasets: no visible binding for global variable ‘modified’   Undefined global functions or variables:     Value issued modified  0 errors ✔ | 0 warnings ✔ | 2 notes ✖

title: Package Development Notes
text: Added package dependencies readxl, stringr, dplyr, tidyr, rlang use_package() Added unit testing structure use_testthat(); created initial (toy) test use_test("hsr_extract_coefficients") Added README file usethis::use_readme_rmd() built default .md file build_readme() Added NEWS.md use_news_md() Added badges (anticipation): use_cran_badge(), use_coverage(), use_github_action("check-standard") Added logo (created hexmake + ChatGPT): use_logo() Started package website use_pkgdown() pkgdown::build_site() get initial site used usethis::use_pkgdown_github_pages() create GitHub Actions workflow update site commit/push. automatically configures GitHub (branch created Pages configured). need push site pkgdown stuff yet. Made inst/extdata/ directory Went QualityNet downloaded FY 2025 HSR (https://qualitynet.cms.gov/inpatient/hrrp/reports#tab3) (11/8/2025 @ 11:56 CST). Added file directory. suggested (https://r-pkgs.org/data.html#sec-data-example-path-helper) created new helper function hsr_example() help identify file users. use_r("hsr_example"). copied exact function definition (changes reflect current package). Added documentation. Added unit test ensure example file exists user file system. final check(), still one (expected) note (resolve later) ``` ❯ checking package subdirectories … NOTE Problems news ‘NEWS.md’: news entries found. ❯ checking R code possible problems … NOTE hsr_extract_coefficients: visible binding global variable ‘Value’ Undefined global functions variables: Value 0 errors ✔ | 0 warnings ✔ | 2 notes ✖ ❯ checking R code possible problems … NOTE hsr_extract_coefficients: visible binding global variable ‘Value’ Undefined global functions variables: Value 0 errors ✔ | 1 warning ✖ | 1 note ✖ ``` Starting next…
code: * Added all FY mock reports to `extdata`. Used `rename_files("hsr_example", "hsr_mock_reports")` to rename the function to be more explicit. Changed all required areas to accomodate change.  # 11/5/2025  * Initialized package by creating repo here: https://github.com/centralstatz/readmit * Then created _New Folder from Git_ in Positron, cloning that repo * Then used `usethis::create_package(getwd())` to initialize package template * Added this file `DEVNOTES.md` to `.Rbuildignore` * Ran `usethis::use_r("hsr_extract_coefficients")` to create the packages first function, which extracts the list of model coefficients from a CMS Hospital Specific Report (HSR) for a specified cohort. Added argument checks. * Used `devtools::load_all()` to test it (works on locally downloaded report). * Did initial `devtools::check()` and got various warnings/notes, which is expected because nothing was configured yet. * Edited the `DESCRIPTION` file (with possibly to change over time as package evolves), and added MIT license with `usethis::use_mit_license()` * Added `roxygen2` documentation to function. Used `devtools::document()` to document it. Added `\dontrun` to roxygen for function as example doesn't work yet. Need to put external data in the package. * Still have warning/note as I haven't declared dependencies, so will do that soon.

what: Tools for navigating, managing, and analyzing hospital readmissions
title: Tools for navigating, managing, and analyzing hospital readmissions
text: goal readmit provide tools make navigating, managing, analyzing hospital readmissions easier transparent.

title: Tools for navigating, managing, and analyzing hospital readmissions
text: can install development version readmit GitHub :

what: Extract risk model coefficients from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_coefficients
title: Extract risk model coefficients from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_coefficients
text: Parses regression coefficients logistic regression model used CMS estimate discharge-level readmission risk, including hospital-level hospital average intercept terms.

title: Extract risk model coefficients from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_coefficients
Extract risk model coefficients from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_coefficients
text: file File path report cohort Cohort extract coefficients . One c("AMI", "COPD", "HF", "PN", "CABG", "HK")

title: Extract risk model coefficients from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_coefficients
text: tibble::tibble() containing columns: Factor: model term name (listed file) Value: model coefficient value (linear predictor scale)

title: Extract risk model coefficients from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_coefficients
code: my_report <- hsr_mock_reports("FY2021_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx") hsr_extract_coefficients(my_report, "AMI") #> # A tibble: 33 × 2 #>    Factor                                                                Value #>    <chr>                                                                 <dbl> #>  1 "Age Minus 65"                                                      0.00998 #>  2 "Male"                                                             -0.0937  #>  3 "Anterior Myocardial Infarction \r\n"                               0.272   #>  4 "Non-Anterior Location of Myocardial Infarction"                    0.0160  #>  5 "History of Coronary Artery Bypass Graft (CABG) Surgery"            0.00330 #>  6 "History of Percutaneous Transluminal Coronary Angioplasty (PTCA)" -0.0108  #>  7 "Severe Infection; Other Infectious Diseases"                       0.0181  #>  8 "Metastatic Cancer and Acute Leukemia"                              0.247   #>  9 "Cancer"                                                            0.0309  #> 10 "Diabetes Mellitus (DM) or DM Complications"                        0.181   #> # ℹ 23 more rows

what: Extract payment summary information from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_payment_summary
title: Extract payment summary information from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_payment_summary
text: Parses Table 1 payment summary HSR, including (limited ) payment penalty, peer group hospital compared , dual proportion determines peer group assignment.

title: Extract payment summary information from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_payment_summary
code: hsr_extract_payment_summary(file)  hsr_count_dual_eligible_stays(file)  hsr_count_total_stays(file)  hsr_dual_proportion(file)  hsr_peer_group(file)  hsr_neutrality_modifier(file)  hsr_payment_adjustment_factor(file)  hsr_payment_penalty(file)

title: Extract payment summary information from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_payment_summary
text: file File path report. convenience functions, can also pre-parsed table hsr_extract_payment_summary() (minimize file /O).

title: Extract payment summary information from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_payment_summary
text: hsr_extract_payment_summary() returns tibble::tibble() containing full Table 1 parsed report. Additional convenience functions extract specific columns table, always return numeric value.

title: Extract payment summary information from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_payment_summary
code: my_report <- hsr_mock_reports("FY2021_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx") payment_summary <- hsr_extract_payment_summary(my_report) payment_summary #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>   Number of Dual Eligible Stays (…¹ Total Number of Stay…² `Dual Proportion [c]` #>                               <dbl>                  <dbl>                 <dbl> #> 1                              2932                  27178                 0.108 #> # ℹ abbreviated names: ¹​`Number of Dual Eligible Stays (Numerator) [a]`, #> #   ²​`Total Number of Stays(Denominator) [b]` #> # ℹ 3 more variables: `Peer Group Assignment [d]` <dbl>, #> #   `Neutrality Modifier [e]` <dbl>, `Payment Adjustment Factor [f]` <dbl>  hsr_payment_penalty(my_report) #> [1] 2e-04 hsr_payment_penalty(payment_summary) #> [1] 2e-04

what: Retrieve file location of mock Hospital-Specific Reports (HSR) — hsr_mock_reports
title: Retrieve file location of mock Hospital-Specific Reports (HSR) — hsr_mock_reports
text: Provides location mock HSRs downloaded QualityNet come package users can import. files representation hospital's real report looks like received CMS. contain mock data sensitive fields (discharge level data, etc.), real data national level results (e.g., model coefficients). Thus, gives user ability practice/explore package functions translate hospital reports. Files include fiscal years (FY) 2019-2025 downloaded 11/8/2025 https://qualitynet.cms.gov/inpatient/hrrp/reports. File names changed better identifiability.

title: Retrieve file location of mock Hospital-Specific Reports (HSR) — hsr_mock_reports
Retrieve file location of mock Hospital-Specific Reports (HSR) — hsr_mock_reports
text: path Name file. NULL, files listed.

title: Retrieve file location of mock Hospital-Specific Reports (HSR) — hsr_mock_reports
text: function adapted readxl::readxl_example().

title: Retrieve file location of mock Hospital-Specific Reports (HSR) — hsr_mock_reports
code: hsr_mock_reports() #> [1] "FY2019_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx" "FY2020_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx" #> [3] "FY2021_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx" "FY2022_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx" #> [5] "FY2023_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx" "FY2024_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx" #> [7] "FY2025_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx" hsr_mock_reports("FY2025_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx") #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/readmit/extdata/FY2025_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx" hsr_extract_payment_summary(hsr_mock_reports("FY2025_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx")) #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   Number of Dually Eligible Stays…¹ Total Number of Stay…² `Dual Proportion [c]` #>                               <dbl>                  <dbl>                 <dbl> #> 1                               186                    856                 0.217 #> # ℹ abbreviated names: ¹​`Number of Dually Eligible Stays (Numerator) [a]`, #> #   ²​`Total Number of Stays(Denominator) [b]` #> # ℹ 4 more variables: `Peer Group Assignment [d]` <dbl>, #> #   `Neutrality Modifier [e]` <dbl>, `Payment Reduction Percentage [f]` <dbl>, #> #   `Payment Adjustment Factor [g]` <dbl>

what: Import datasets from the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_read
title: Import datasets from the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_read
text: Explore import datasets directly CMS Provider Data Catalog (PDC). pdc_topics(): Retrieves list topics (subcategories) data available pdc_datasets(): Retrieves identifiers, names, descriptions, metadata associated datasets (optionally specified) topics pdc_read(): Imports full dataset given identifier (datasetid). found pdc_datasets().

title: Import datasets from the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_read
Import datasets from the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_read
text: datasetid dataset identifier (e.g., pdc_datasets()) ... Additional arguments passed readr::read_csv() topics topic list dataset metadata (e.g., pdc_topics())

title: Import datasets from the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_read
text: character vector listing available data topics, tibble::tibble() containing requested data/metadata.

title: Import datasets from the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_read
code: pdc_topics() #>  [1] "Dialysis facilities"                    #>  [2] "Doctors and clinicians"                 #>  [3] "Home health services"                   #>  [4] "Hospice care"                           #>  [5] "Hospitals"                              #>  [6] "Inpatient rehabilitation facilities"    #>  [7] "Long-term care hospitals"               #>  [8] "Nursing homes including rehab services" #>  [9] "Physician office visit costs"           #> [10] "Supplier directory"                     pdc_datasets("Hospitals") |>    dplyr::filter(stringr::str_detect(title, "(?i)readmission")) #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   datasetid topic     title        description issued     modified   downloadurl #>   <chr>     <chr>     <chr>        <chr>       <date>     <date>     <chr>       #> 1 9n3s-kdb3 Hospitals Hospital Re… In October… 2020-12-10 2025-01-08 https://da… pdc_read("9n3s-kdb3") #> Rows: 18510 Columns: 12 #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Delimiter: "," #> chr (11): Facility Name, Facility ID, State, Measure Name, Number of Dischar... #> dbl  (1): Footnote #>  #> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message. #> # A tibble: 18,510 × 12 #>    `Facility Name`     `Facility ID` State `Measure Name` `Number of Discharges` #>    <chr>               <chr>         <chr> <chr>          <chr>                  #>  1 SOUTHEAST HEALTH M… 010001        AL    READM-30-AMI-… 296                    #>  2 SOUTHEAST HEALTH M… 010001        AL    READM-30-CABG… 151                    #>  3 SOUTHEAST HEALTH M… 010001        AL    READM-30-HF-H… 681                    #>  4 SOUTHEAST HEALTH M… 010001        AL    READM-30-HIP-… N/A                    #>  5 SOUTHEAST HEALTH M… 010001        AL    READM-30-PN-H… 490                    #>  6 SOUTHEAST HEALTH M… 010001        AL    READM-30-COPD… 130                    #>  7 MARSHALL MEDICAL C… 010005        AL    READM-30-CABG… N/A                    #>  8 MARSHALL MEDICAL C… 010005        AL    READM-30-HIP-… N/A                    #>  9 MARSHALL MEDICAL C… 010005        AL    READM-30-HF-H… 176                    #> 10 MARSHALL MEDICAL C… 010005        AL    READM-30-PN-H… 305                    #> # ℹ 18,500 more rows #> # ℹ 7 more variables: Footnote <dbl>, `Excess Readmission Ratio` <chr>, #> #   `Predicted Readmission Rate` <chr>, `Expected Readmission Rate` <chr>, #> #   `Number of Readmissions` <chr>, `Start Date` <chr>, `End Date` <chr>

what: readmit: Tools for navigating, managing, and analyzing hospital readmissions — readmit-package
title: readmit: Tools for navigating, managing, and analyzing hospital readmissions — readmit-package
text: Contains toolkits datasets make managing hospital readmissions easier transparent. Particular context given Hospital Readmissions Reduction Program (HRRP) Center Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) understanding program details analyzing reports.

title: readmit: Tools for navigating, managing, and analyzing hospital readmissions — readmit-package
text: Maintainer: Alex Zajichek alex@centralstatz.com

title: readmit (development version)
text: Initial CRAN submission.
